title: Triumph of the nomads
creator_credit: David Morgan, Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
brief_description: Ancient Australia is often seen as a land of stagnation and the early Australians were depicted as one of the most primitive peoples on earth. However, this program examines how the long occupation of pre-white-invasion Australia witnessed spectacular changes. Generations of First Nations peoples saw the great rising of the seas which isolated Australia; they saw, and probably influenced, sweeping changes in vegetation and wildlife. First Nations peoples created lifestyles which suited their environments. Narrated by Geoffrey Blainey.
